newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE cocoa down in holiday-thinned trade.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE cocoa down in holiday-thinned trade.

text.p: LIFFE cocoa trading volumes hit their lowest level in months in the morning session as Ivory Coast and many European markets closed for the Assumption Day holiday.
"This is the worst volume in several months," a trader said as only 413 lots were traded in the session.
September opened seven stg down at 1,007 after New York ended moderately lower overnight in quiet trade, but edged upwards to close five stg down at 1,009.
Active December was four down at 1,039 stg. The back months were between four and eight stg down apart from May and September 1998 which were not traded.
"With cable at 59 we should be four down and we are four down," a trader said. "There's no feature at all."
Sterling see-sawed at mid-day in Europe in a holiday-thinned market, making early gains against the dollar but meeting resistance at $1.60 and falling back to $1.5975.
Traders saw no new elements likely to stimulate the market in the short term.
